intro: Papaver rhoeas proles roubiei, commonly known as the Robiei poppy, is a variant of the common poppy. It is a herbaceous annual plant characterized by its striking red petals and a prominent central stigma. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with smooth, erect stems and alternate, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, adding vibrant color to gardens and natural landscapes. This cultivar is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often used in floral arrangements and as a garden plant.
